roleset.name: piss off, causing to feel like an outsider
roleset.note: ALIENATE-V NOTES: Member of Vncls amuse-31.1. (from alienate.01-v) Frames file for 'alienate' based on sentences in wsj. (from alienate.01-v predicate notes)ALIENATION-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, alienate.01. Corresponds to VNcls amuse-31.1. (from alienation.01-n)

example.name: just transitive
example.text: With only two issues under its belt, Garbage has alienated some would-be advertisers and raised the ire of others.
example.arg: With only two issues under its belt

example.name: with instrument
example.text: [They]-1 chance *trace*-1 alienating the customers they hope to woo by looking like opportunistic sharks.
example.arg: the customers they hope to woo

example.name: arg0
example.text: Welfare and other mechanisms of redistribution under capitalism are little more than the throwing of crumbs at the many who otherwise suffer the worst effects of its alienation and exploitation .

example.name: args1, 2
example.text: It would just stagnate and eventually decline due to people 's alienation from deep conservative traditions which may no longer be relevant to modern living .
example.arg: from deep conservative traditions which may no longer be relevant to modern living
